HydrationError.what: Server-rendered HTML doesn't match client-rendered HTML
HydrationError.why: Different output between server and client render, often from browser APIs or random values
fix: Remove browser-only APIs (window, document) from initial render
Avoid Date.now() or Math.random() in render
Check for conditional rendering based on client state
Use suppressHydrationWarning only as last resort

ModuleNotFound.what: Cannot find module or file to import
ModuleNotFound.why: Import path is incorrect, file doesn't exist, or package isn't installed
fix: Verify the import path is correct (check typos)
Ensure the file exists at the specified location
Install missing npm packages: npm install <package>
Check if using .js extension when needed (or remove it)

ServerClientMismatch.what: Different behavior between server and client components
ServerClientMismatch.why: Code behaves differently in server vs client environment
fix: Mark component with 'use client' directive if it needs browser APIs
Move client-only logic to useEffect hooks
Check for environment-specific code (process.env, window checks)
Ensure consistent data fetching on both server and client
